framework.control

Class LocalizationConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.control.LocalizationConnector

  • public class LocalizationConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    Connector to the framework for all other parts to access the localization subsystem.
    Author:
    Stefan Werner

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LocalizationConnector()
      Instantiates a new localization connector without a connected localization controller.
      LocalizationConnector(java.lang.String componentId, i18n.iface.LocalizationController localizationController)
      Instantiates a new localization connector.

    • Method Summary

      Adds an external localization resource to the system.

      Gets the local text orientation (left to right or right to left).

    • Constructor Detail

      • LocalizationConnector

        public LocalizationConnector()
        Instantiates a new localization connector without a connected localization controller. It can be used but does not translate anything. Usefull for testing.

      • LocalizationConnector

        public LocalizationConnector(java.lang.String componentId,
                             i18n.iface.LocalizationController localizationController)
        Instantiates a new localization connector.
        Parameters:
        componentId - the component id
        localizationController - the localization controller

    • Method Detail

      • addLocalizationResource

        public boolean addLocalizationResource(java.lang.String resourceLocation)
        Adds an external localization resource to the system.
        Parameters:
        resourceLocation - the resource location
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        See Also:
        LocalizationController.addLocalizationResource(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)

      • getLocalizedString

        public java.lang.String getLocalizedString(java.lang.String defaultString)
        Gets a localized string. Will return the default string if localized version is unavailable.
        Parameters:
        defaultString - the default string
        Returns:
        the localized string
        See Also:
        LocalizationController.getLocalizedString(java.lang.String)

      • getLocalizedString

        public java.lang.String getLocalizedString(java.lang.String defaultString,
                                           boolean onlyUseFrameworkResources)
        Gets a localized string. Will return the default string if localized version is unavailable. Will optionally only consider internal resources and not externally added ones.
        Parameters:
        defaultString - the default string
        onlyUseFrameworkResources - set to true to only use internal framework resources
        Returns:
        the localized string
        See Also:
        LocalizationController.getLocalizedString(java.lang.String, boolean)

      • getLocalTextOrientation

        public TextOrientationType getLocalTextOrientation()
        Gets the local text orientation (left to right or right to left).
        Returns:
        the local text orientation
        See Also:
        LocalizationController.getLocalTextOrientation()

      • removeLocalizationResource

        public boolean removeLocalizationResource()
        Removes an external localization resource from the system.
        Returns:
        true, if successful
        See Also:
        LocalizationController.removeLocalizationResource(java.lang.String)
